Copier Leasing in PH: A Smart Choice for Businesses

February 1, 2024 Marga Enterprises

Introduction: Why Copier Leasing in PH Is Gaining Popularity

In today’s fast-paced work environment, efficiency and flexibility are essential. One critical yet often overlooked area is document printing and copying. That’s why many businesses are now turning to copier leasing in PH as a practical alternative to purchasing. Whether you’re running a startup or managing a large enterprise, leasing gives you access to modern machines without the hefty upfront cost.

In this post, we’ll explore the benefits, costs, and practical tips for maximizing the value of copier leasing in the Philippines.

What Is Copier Leasing?

Copier leasing refers to an agreement where a business rents a copier or multifunction printer (MFP) from a service provider for a fixed period, usually 12 to 60 months. Instead of buying the machine outright, the business pays a monthly fee that covers the equipment and, often, maintenance and support services.

Benefits of Copier Leasing in PH

1. Lower Initial Costs

Purchasing a high-quality copier can be a huge expense. With leasing, you avoid this large capital outlay and spread the cost over time. This setup is especially beneficial for small and medium enterprises (SMEs) that want to preserve cash flow.

2. Access to the Latest Technology

Copier leasing in PH gives you access to up-to-date equipment with modern features. At the end of your lease, you can upgrade to newer models without needing to sell or dispose of old equipment.

3. Predictable Monthly Budgeting

Leasing provides fixed monthly payments, which make it easier to plan your office expenses. You can also explore tips on how to budget for copier rentals to ensure your leasing plan fits within your financial framework.

4. Included Maintenance and Support

Most leasing packages include service agreements, reducing downtime and ensuring your copier stays in good working condition. This means fewer worries about repair costs or technical issues.

Factors Affecting the Cost of Copier Leasing

Not all leases are priced equally. Several factors influence the total cost of copier leasing in PH, such as:

  • Machine Type: Color copiers cost more than black-and-white models.

  • Monthly Print Volume: The more pages you print, the higher the wear and tear on the machine.

  • Lease Term: Longer leases often have lower monthly payments.

  • Inclusions: Some leases include ink, toner, paper, and regular maintenance.

For more details, check out this guide on factors affecting copier rental prices.

Renting vs. Buying: Which Is Better?

The decision to rent or buy a copier depends on your company’s financial goals and usage needs. However, renting often comes out ahead in terms of flexibility and cost-efficiency.

Here’s a quick cost comparison of renting vs. buying a copier that can help you decide which option suits your business best.

How to Choose the Right Leasing Plan

When considering copier leasing in PH, it’s important to assess your business needs. Ask the following questions:

  • How many copies/prints do you need per month?

  • Do you require color printing or scanning features?

  • Will the lease include maintenance and supply replenishment?

  • Can you scale up or down if your business changes?

Look closely at lease terms, payment plans, and upgrade options. You can also read tips for analyzing lease terms for cost-efficiency to avoid long-term financial burdens.

How to Save Money on Copier Rentals

Saving on copier leasing doesn’t mean cutting corners. Here are practical ways to reduce expenses:

  • Bundle Services: Choose a package that includes maintenance, support, and consumables.

  • Negotiate Terms: Ask for flexible upgrades and early termination options.

  • Compare Providers: Don’t settle for the first quote—shop around.

  • Track Usage: Monitor how much you print to avoid overage charges.

To learn more, read this guide on saving money on copier rentals.

Common Lease Types in the Philippines

1. Fair Market Value Lease (FMV)

You pay less monthly, but at the end of the lease, you either return the machine or buy it at fair market value.

2. $1 Buyout Lease

This lets you own the copier at the end of the lease by paying just ₱1 (or a nominal fee). Monthly payments are higher, but there’s no need to negotiate later.

3. Operating Lease

Great for short-term or seasonal use. Ideal for events, campaigns, or pop-up offices.

Who Should Consider Copier Leasing?

Copier leasing in PH is ideal for:

  • Small Businesses: Lower cost and low risk.

  • Growing Companies: Easy to scale up as demand increases.

  • Schools and NGOs: Fixed costs and reliable service for tight budgets.

  • Corporate Offices: High-volume printing with guaranteed support.

Final Thoughts: Make the Smart Move

Copier leasing in PH offers a reliable, cost-effective, and scalable solution for businesses of all sizes. With the right plan, you can avoid large upfront costs, gain access to modern equipment, and enjoy peace of mind with included maintenance and support.

Before signing any lease, take time to understand your usage, compare providers, and read the fine print. If done right, leasing can streamline your operations and improve overall productivity.
